Item.text: I think the answer is something like this.
I think I know a part of the answer.
And can you tell me more?
Is there anything else about that?
Alright. Could you elaborate on that a little?
I'm not so sure about that.
I don't think that is right.
Come on, I bet you can tell me something.
ok. Just give me what you know.
Could you try to give me an answer? I really need your help.
Jordan, can you answer this question?
Having trouble deciding? Let me choose one for you.
I'm sorry, that is not correct.
Cristina, hi. what are we working on today?
Item.speech: Cristina,hi. what are we working on two day?

Item.text: We are going to try a bit of trivia to review the skills we have learned.
Great! What do we need to do?
Each category has 4 questions with point values of 100, 200, 300, and 400. The 400 point questions are the most difficult.
You will go back to the main page to pick your next question. After correct answers, the score bar at the top will fill with the amount of points that the question was worth.
When you have completely filled the bar you have completed the activity.
Correct answers will be indicated in green.
Choose a question by clicking on one of the numbers below a category.
Cool. So, what happens when we click a number?
A question will appear. You can answer a question by clicking on the answer buttons.
You see that there are four categories for the questions.
Text signals, writer's purpose, using clues, and mixed review.
I see. So, what are the numbers under each category?
Wow! It looks like you got all the points needed to finish this lesson. Great job with this activity.
_user_, you were amazing! This was a good chance to practice.
I'm glad you seem to have learned so much using this program.
_user_ and Cristina, thanks again. See you next time.
Awesome! Let's start the game then!

Question.text: What type of text signal is displayed in the box below? _user_, Click on your answer.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The text signal in the graphic is a visual cue.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The text signal in the box is a visual cue. A visual cue is a picture, graph, or image which can help us to understand what we are reading.

Question.text: What type of text signal is displayed in the box below?_user_, Click your answer.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The text signal in the graphic is a visual cue.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The text signal in the box is a visual cue. A visual cue is a picture, graph, or image which can help us to understand what we are reading.

Question.text: What does the acronym DMV mean in this sentence? I have to stop by the DMV to renew my driver's license.

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I think it's Department of Motor Vehicles.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I think it's District of Mount Vernon.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I think it's Division of Multiple Vehicles.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The acronym DMV means Department of Motor Vehicles.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The acronym DMV means Department of Motor Vehicles. The text clue drivers' license in the sentence helps us to choose the correct meaning of DMV.

Question.text: What is the meaning of present in this sentence? Danielle brought a present to the party.

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: Does present mean now, in this moment of time?

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: Does present mean to put on a show or demonstration?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The word present in this sentence means a gift.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The word present in this sentence means a gift. The context clue party in the sentence helps us to understand that present means a gift.

Answer.text: The word present in this sentence means a gift.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer

Question.text: What word in the sentence below helps us to define the word Monongahela? Many people think that the Monongahela is the most beautiful river in Pittsburgh.
Question.speech: What word in the sentence below helps us to define the word manongguhheeluh? Many people think that the manongguhheeluh is the most beautiful river in Pittsburgh.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The word that helps to define Monongahela is the word river.
Answer.speech: The word that helps to define manongguhheeluh is the word river.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The word that helps to define Monongahela is the word river. When we replace Monongahela with each one of the answer words, the word river makes the most sense.
Answer.speech: The word that helps to define manongguhheeluh is the word river. When we replace manongguhheeluh with each one of the answer words, the word river makes the most sense.

Question.text: Choose what the writer is expressing with this punctuation in the sentence below. Carol's son asked her, Can I invite my friends over when I finish my homework.

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I think that the writer is asking a question.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I think that the writer is making a statement.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I think that the writer is expressing strong emotion.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The punctuation mark says that the writer is asking a question.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The punctuation mark says that the writer is asking a question. The writer uses the question mark to show that Carol's son is asking to invite his friends over.

Question.text: Choose what the writer is expressing with this punctuation in the sentence below. Carol's son asked her, Can I invite my friends over when I finish my homework.

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I think that the writer is asking a question.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I think that the writer is making a statement.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I think that the writer is expressing strong emotion.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The punctuation mark says that the writer is asking a question.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The punctuation mark says that the writer is asking a question. The writer uses the question mark to show that Carol's son is asking to invite his friends over.

Question.text: What is the metaphor in this sentence? At her banking job Celeste is a machine, but when she gets home she crashes.

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I choose at her banking job.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I choose Celeste is a machine.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I choose when she gets home she crashes.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The metaphor in the sentence is Celeste is a machine.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The metaphor in the sentence is Celeste is a machine. The metaphor means that Celeste works very hard the same way that a computer works very hard and makes no mistakes.

Question.text: What is the metaphor in this sentence? At her banking job Celeste is a machine, but when she gets home she crashes.

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I choose at her banking job.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I choose Celeste is a machine.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I choose when she gets home she crashes.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The metaphor in the sentence is Celeste is a machine.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The metaphor in the sentence is Celeste is a machine. The metaphor means that Celeste works very hard the same way that a computer works very hard and makes no mistakes.

Question.text: What clarifying question helps us understand the word bear in the sentence below? While fixing her deck, Dominique learns that the beams she is using must be able to bear up to 200 pounds.

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I think she should ask what is the purpose of the text.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I think she should ask is there a comparison being made.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I think she should choose what are the two or more definitions for this word.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The clarifying question that Dominique should ask is what are the two or more definitions for this word.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The clarifying question that Dominique should ask is what are the two or more definitions for this word. # Bear can mean a large animal, but here the word bear means hold. As in, she has to make sure the beams she is using can hold up to 200 pounds.

Question.text: What clarifying question helps us understand the word bear in the sentence below? While fixing her deck, Dominique learns that the beams she is using must be able to bear up to 200 pounds.

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I think she should ask what is the purpose of the text.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I think she should ask is there a comparison being made.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I think she should choose what are the two or more definitions for this word.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The clarifying question that Dominique should ask is what are the two or more definitions for this word.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The clarifying question that Dominique should ask is what are the two or more definitions for this word. Bear can mean a large animal, but here the word bear means hold. As in, she has to make sure the beams she is using can hold up to 200 pounds.

Question.text: In the sentence below, a simile is being used to compare which two things? After a cold afternoon building a snowman, Maurice's hands were like icicles.
Question.speech: In the sentence below, a simile is being used to compare which two things? After a cold afternoon building a snow man, Mawreese's hands were like icicles.

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I think the two things are Maurice and snowman.
Answer.speech: I think the two things are Maureese and snowman.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I think the two things are hands and icicles.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I think the two things are hands and cold.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The two things being compared with a simile are hands and icicles.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The two things being compared with a simile are hands and icicles. The simile in the sentence is Maurice's hands were like icicles where the word like compares hands and icicles.
Answer.speech: The two things being compared with a simile are hands and icicles. The simile in the sentence is Mawreese's hands were like icicles where the word like compares hands and icicles.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I think the two things are hands and icicles.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I think the two things are hands and cold.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The two things being compared with a simile are hands and icicles.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The two things being compared with a simile are hands and icicles. The simile in the sentence is Maurice's hands were like icicles where the word, like, compares hands and icicles.
Answer.speech: The two things being compared with a simile are hands and icicles. The simile in the sentence is Mawreese's hands were like icicles where the word, like, compares hands and icicles.

Question.text: Fill in the blank. The italics, colors, and text size in this text are examples of what.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The italics, colors, and text size are examples of print cues.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The italics, colors, and text size are examples of print cues. In print cues, the text itself is altered by things like red letters, underlining, and large print to highlight information.

Question.text: Fill in the blank. The italics, colors, and text size in this text are examples of what.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The italics, colors, and text size are examples of print cues.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The italics, colors, and text size are examples of print cues. In print cues, the text itself is altered by things like red letters, underlining, and large print to highlight information.

Question.text: Based on the text signals, what kind of book do you think this is?

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I think it's a baby book.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: Based on the text signals, this is a cookbook.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: Based on the text signals, this is a cookbook. The picture is of a donut, and the subtitle is gluten free vegan recipes from donuts to snickerdoodles.

Question.text: Use the text signals to help determine which bus station is re-opened.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The bus station that is now reopened is Pape Station.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The bus station that is now reopened is Pape Station. Based on the text signals, we read both Pape Station Reopened and the sentence Pape Station is now open.

Question.text: Click the word below that is the root of the following example.

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I think the root is pleasing.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I think the root is easy.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I think the root is please.

Answer.name: ChooseD
Answer.text: I think the root is sing.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The root of the word displeasing is please.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The root of the example word is please. The prefix d-i-s means not and the suffix i-n-g means it is currently happening. So, displeasing is something that is not pleasing right now.

Answer.name: ResponseB
Answer.text: That is not the correct root.

Answer.name: ResponseB
Answer.text: That is not the correct root.

Question.text: Click the word below that is the root of the following example.

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I think the root is intre.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I think the root is repidly.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: This is tough. I think it is trep.

Answer.name: ChooseD
Answer.text: I'm not sure. Maybe the root is trepid.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The root of this word is trepid.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The root of the example word is trepid. The prefix in means not and the suffix i-n-g indicates that an action is being done a certain way. So, intrepidly means doing something without fear or hesitation.

Answer.name: ResponseC
Answer.text: That is not the answer I was looking for.

Question.text: Alright, let's try again. Click the word below that is the root of the following example.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I think the root is trep.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The root of this word is trepid.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The root of the example word is trepid. The prefix in means not and the suffix i-n-g indicates that an action is being done a certain way. So, intrepidly means doing something without fear or hesitation.

Question.text: Which of the following strategies is an example of using context clues?

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I think it's predicting author's purpose.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I think it's reading the words around a confusing word.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I think it's using the dictionary.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: Reading the words around a confusing word is an example of using context clues.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: Reading the words around a confusing word is an example of using context clues. When you read the words around a confusing word it can help you to understand the meaning of the confusing word.
